Reviews.Title: “Great for Overnight”
Reviews.Author: gidget_8
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn always provides good service. The rooms are basically all the same with the usual reliable amenities,service and great showers. This property is very close to Seaworld and was our first choice, so we were delighted when there was a vacancy.After dark was a bit scary as we encountered several homeless persons just crossing the road to go to Dennys.. However that would not stop me from staying here again as its not in a location where you would need to venture out at night

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, near bike/walking trail, lots of public transport options”
Reviews.Author: birdl0ver
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with super friendly and knowledgeable staff. We came for the Audubon Bird Festival. We did not want to hassle with a car rental and hotel staff helped with transportation options (taxi, public transport, maps, suggested routes) so we could get to the festival and to downtown. Really easy!!! There is a bus stop right on the corner with frequent busses running to SeaWorld, Mission Beach and to the Olde Towne transportation center where you can catch the trolley downtown. Hotel is only 2 blocks away from a great bike/walking trail along the San Diego River. The neighborhood is fine. We took several walks around. Lots of good independent eateries and also chains (if you want....) . There is a CVS pharmacy right across the street where you can get groceries, wine, sundries. Very convenient location, but away from the tourist crowd, and extremely helpful staff. We will definitely stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruhk
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very nice! Hotel in very close to Sea World and Golf courses. Hotel Breakfast is good the breakfast room is rather small. Denny's is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: daisymae
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little difficult to find even with a GPS. If you don't take the turn immediately you will end up on the freeway and waste an abundance of time. Don't let the exterior of the building fool you.l As you enter the building you are greeted very friendly by the front desk. The reception area is tasteful, modern and the adjacent breakfast area is clean and welcoming. I had a non-smoking room which had modern furnishings, pillow top beds, fair size fridge & microwave. I wasn't impressed with the overall area however it was in close proximity to the Sports Arena and accessible to major freeways. The room was clean and the bathroom really impressed me with a granite countertop; something I wasn't expecting. The TV was the old type but they are slowing being replaced by flatscreens. I did not think the coffee pot was sanitary as it was made all of plastic and you drop the filter in as well. So when I wanted to make tea, my tea tasted terrible as it smelled like coffee or a mix of the two. Those need to be replaced by a new system with a glass carafe. The walls are relatively thin so that was a downfall if there was someone noisy next door. The hotel is fairly quiet and you do not hear the street noise.The free breakfast was great offering cereal, milk, yoghourt, juices, pancakes, toast, bagels, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, coffee, muffins, hard boiled eggs. There is a computer in the reception area you may use with free internet and there is an elevator in the building. My major concern would be the back door which is connected to the parking lot does not close properly which is next to the elevator as well. This is not a good security feature as if someone does not check the door behind them, it won't close properly and anyone can enter the elevator and roam the halls. The reception area has survelliance and monitors it however this is not enough. For the safety of the guests, and being the brand name holiday inn, it is imperative the door get replaced. Guests must use their room cards for the door to open however, sometimes the door sticks. I must say the hotel definitely is great value and the staff really try hard to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Keep making the improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience and couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Jen C
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6-night stay here and we were thoroughly impressed with our 2 queen, 1 sofabed room. Great space, newly renovated rooms, floors, and lobbies, and enough space for the 5 of us comfortably in our room. We enjoyed the full breakfast daily and felt the staff couldn't have been nicer and more than accommodating. Even one day we got to the breakfast after closing, they still offered to refill pancakes for us without ever being asked. Close proximity to stores, restaurants, and the highways. Have to say we most appreciated the silence and peace and quiet in the room. Couldn't hear neighbors in any direction which was wonderful for a restful night. We will definitely stay again should we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a very friendly, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: lily1646
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Holiday Inn Express that had just been renovated throughout the hotel, so everything was fresh and attractive. The location was ideal with easy access to two major highways: I-8 & I-5., which was important so we easily could get around the city. It also is very close to Sea World. The front desk team, especially the manager, Luz, were delightful and they made us happy to be there. The breakfast was delicious and a bargain especially considering the high quality and variety of food. The ladies who worked in the breakfast room always were delightful and worked hard to keep all the items replenished. The hotel doesnâ€™t have a regular restaurant, of course, but there are many in the neighborhood. We walked to Red Lobster around the corner for dinner and got good recommendations for other restaurants. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: DaveGold
Reviews.Content: We probooked this hotel to get a better rate, we were pleasantly surprised at the quality this hotel offers. I would rate this hotel anytime on-par we a Hilton or Sheraton hotel! The rooms are spacious, our room had 2 double beds (4 pillows each - soft & firm) + a sofa bed that opened into another bed - with extra pillows and sheets in the closet. Rooms had nice stylish square & round lamps modern looking headboards, and clean carpet so that our baby could crawl freely. Bathroom has nice granite counter, and is very clean! Lobby has a computer that we used for checking e-mails and checking-in to our flight in advance. Breakfast area has nice round tables, chairs & highchairs that you can use to eat - anytime (we even ate our own lunch there). We didn't utilize the breakfast, but it looked delicious and the staff kept on refilling everything constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for Sea World.”
Reviews.Author: Islander808
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay there. Clean rooms, nice breakfast to start our days, wondered staff,and 5 minutes to Sea World. The area around the hotel is so so. I wouldn't recommend walking outside, and the parking stalls are a little tight. The underground parking could use security gates or a guard, but we didn't see any problems during our stay. But I wouldn't leave any valuables in your car. Very close to many restaurants. Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: I moved to Holiday Inn Express after two bad evenings at the Ramada Inn. Wow what a difference when I walked into Holiday Inn Express. It was clean, friendly staff and such a nicer hotel. The hotel accommodated several of us that had left the Ramada. The rooms were 100% cleaner and nicer than the Ramada and when I walked into the room at Holiday Inn Express both my son and I said, ahhh. It was so nice to be in a clean environment and have an air conditioner that worked. We were there 7 evenings and I have no complaints. I wanted to stay an extra evening and they made that happen with no issues. Plus, I loved that they had cookies in the lobby for the guests every afternoon. Family friendly hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great HIX hotel. Don't worry about the area it's great!”
Reviews.Author: Mazalo
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews regrading the hotel's area so I'll start there. Do NOT worry! I felt very safe returning a night. The hotel is very nice and clean and the staff are amazing. I especially liked the fact that the hotel made lists of places close to the hotel - places where you can visit. We were five people and recieved a big and clean room/ Also it's very close to Sea World which is nice! A lot a restaurant's nearby (with a car :)) Breakfast was a typical HIX breakfast (which I love!) The only thing is that the dining area is very small so some people had to eat standing up. Would 100% come back and would reccomend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place when visiting Sea World”
Reviews.Author: AuntieRene
Reviews.Content: We landed at Long Beach, California, rented a car and drove to San Diego. Took about 3 hours during rush hour. We returned to Long Beach and the drive was about 1 hour without rush hour. The location is great when visiting Sea World. The staff were very friendly. Breakfast was what you expected. The free parking in the well lit lot was great and the beds were extremely comfortable (with the exception of the pull out sofa bed) not the best mattress in the world!. There were 3 adults and 2 kids and the room was very large. We would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: funluv65
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly an helpful. The room was very clean! The bed was amazing I did not want to get up the next morning it was so comfy. The breakfast was hot and fresh. I was very pleased with the selection that fit my diet plan that I am on. The underground parking was very well lit and I felt very safe

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the rough”
Reviews.Author: lettybeck
Reviews.Content: I was a bit thrown off by the neighborhood, but once you are inside the hotel you are ok. Room was clean. The beds were comfortable. I have a super sharp sense of smell and room smelled clean. Hallways clean and lobby is pretty and front desk staff is friendly. A bit noisy outside, not the prettiest view from outside but we were overall very pleased with this little hotel

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and comfortable. Minor annoyance”
Reviews.Author: scoredonu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. It was located near another hotel where I was attending a wedding. Pros I thought the beds were comfortable, and room layouts were decent. Room had a fridge. Cons Not a great location. No non fast food places to walk to to eat. Cleaning service was vacuuming loudly in the hallway outside the room at 8:30 am on Sunday morning. The minor annoyance was I asked the front desk to call me a taxi. When I arrived downstairs they had informed me that they had called a town car. The taxi ride was only gonna be 4 minutes so the fare was supposed to be cheap. Town car was a much higher flat rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: texasmom47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Sea World and Coronado Island. We had a Shamu Suite which was perfect for 2 kids and mom & dad. The hotel was exceptionally clean and though a iltte dated, the rooms were very well equiped. We did not use the pool much only because we were on the go alot. But the commons areas and outdoor areas were clean.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy0055
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a family trip to Seaworld, with our 4 year old and 7 month old. The hotel is really nice and clean and the front desk was so GREAT. They let us check in early and were so accomodating. Even when we left they offered us waters for the drive home. Just excellent customer service. The breakfast was basic but good enough and there is an IHOP across the street. The baby had an actual crib. Smaller than a normal crib but not a pack n play. Over all great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Questionable Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Mom2nat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was difficult to find, even with gps, as it is not near hotel row. We passed a handful of strip clubs on the way - a side of San Diego we hadn't seen. "Don't look kids!" On-site parking available. The hotel & grounds were clean. Check-in was quick. Free cookies in the lobby. The elevator was slow (couldn't locate the stairs). Our room was clean, fresh, and roomy. Many channels to choose from on the t.v. Comfy beds. Free breakfast from 6am-9am (somewhat tasty). Small pool w/depth ranging from 3' to 4', and miniscule but piping-hot hot tub. SECOND NIGHT - lobby vase stolen, accident in the parking garage (only now found damage to our front end), kids yelling in the parking garage. Didn't stay a 3rd night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Owners & Service, but Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: shysue
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly average Holiday Inn Express, maybe even a notch below, but mainly because of the noise factor. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable with soft and cozy linens, but the constant door slamming made relaxing and getting a good nights sleep nearly impossible. Why oh why can't hotels come up with a door closing system that will avoid the loud BANG when inconsiderate hotel guests let the door slam? I've always been mystified by that. Also there were children running up and down the hallway, but there's not a whole lot the hotel can do about rude parents who can't or won't control their children. The room had a small fridge and a microwave, and we used the former but not the latter and the fridge actually kept things cold, which seems to be not a consistent feature with hotel fridges. We had one hotel (not this one) tell us that the fridges in the room were actually "cooler boxes" and so weren't expected to keep the items cold. What? That's just ridiculous. Dolly at the front desk was very sweet and helpful, and there were great "welcome" cookies by the registration desk that were a nice perk. She also presented me with a gift bag of snacks for being a HIE Priority Customer when I checked into the hotel. Parking is tight but there seemed to be plenty of spaces, at least there were at the times we needed to park. There's a shopping center across the street with several restaurants and a pharmacy (if memory serves it was a CVS) so good places to eat are withing walking distance. You just take your life into your hands if you attempt to jaywalk across Sports Arena Blvd. Play it safe and walk a bit to use the signal just a short ways down the street. Oh, lots of street noise and police/fire sirens as well. Windows are not what I would call soundproof by any means. If I were to stay here again I'd ask for a room on the other side of the building, facing away from Sports Arena Blvd. Again, very, very noisy making for a not very peaceful sleep. I slept with earplugs all three nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff and awesome breakfast !!”
Reviews.Author: Yamini_kaur
Reviews.Content: When travelling with young kids, we always look for places with breakfast and a good spread helps the finicky kids start the day with a full stomach . This place was awesome as far as the facilities were concerned, the staff was very helpful (even lending us the weighing machine to weigh our bags) and friendly. They are very close to sea-world, making it very convenient for sea-world visitors. I would highly recommend this place and we'd stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “It's the inside that matters”
Reviews.Author: makuwet
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy on the outside but the room that we were given was very clean and just the right size. Beds were really comfortable. If you check in late like we did, you will be warmly greeted by a very friendly front desk hotel staff named Dolly, who was also helpful in giving out flyers for nearby restaurants that have delivery service so we can just order in instead of going out. Definitely worth the price we paid, considering it included free wi-fi, indoor parking and breakfast plus a small refrigerator and microwave in the room. Even if the outside of this hotel is not really impressive, it's what you find inside that will give you a lasting impression - clean, comfortable beds, and friendly front desk staff. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay near the Sea World San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: mybaybee
Reviews.Content: Planned a trip to Sea World, booked online at the Heritage Inn. Was a horrible place we were in then out in 5 mins, I noticed the Holiday Inn Express as we were driving to the Heritage Inn and decided to see if they had any rooms available. Very friendly staff, felt safe. The room was very clean and spacious recently done up. No complaints at all except there is not alotta good tv channels, lol. There is a fridge and microwave in room. Stayed with my two small children. Arrived at night and area around hotels was not desireable looking but I felt good in my room. Dennys and CVS right across the st, Will recommend spending a lil extra for the comforts and securities especially with kids!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: lmhTorrance_CA
Reviews.Content: Okay hotel for the price. Typical Hliday Inn Express. The usual breakfast, nice service, etc. Breakfast room is small and the pool is even smaller, but who cares, right? The hotel is 2 minutes away from Sea World. Looking for a nicer Hol Inn Express in the area? Then stay at the one in La Jolla. Problem is that the La Jolla hotel is about 40% more expensive. Those going to Sea World: To hand feed the dolphins, get to the park about 9:45 AM tp get in line. The feeding starts at 10:30 and they now charge everyone $6 to have an employee sit and help you feed and pet a dolphin. Greta experience!

Reviews.Title: “more bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Kristina05
Reviews.Content: Despite initial misgivings when we first drove up to this hotel (the surroundings are not particularly inviting but they do not feel unsafe), we were pleased with our entire visit. The location can't be beat, especially if you are planning a "child friendly" trip - 2 minutes from Seaworld or the boardwalk, 10-15 minutes from the Zoo, and about the same to La Jolla. One of the two main highways runs next to the hotel for easy access to all destinations, whether Legoland or Coronado. Because the hotel was recently renovated, the rooms are clean, "well dressed", and have both mini fridge and microwave. Shower had decent water pressure. The daily breakfast has something for everyone - the hot food was not very good and the pastries seemed a bit stale, but yogurt, fresh fruit, and bagels with cream cheese were more than acceptable alternatives, and the coffee is weirdly fantastic. When we were there, service was five star worthy. Staff was friendly, very accommodating, and fast - we noticed spilled ketchup in the elevator on our way up which had been cleaned by the time we went back down about 15 minutes later. Free computer use with internet access is on the main floor if you want to research restaurants, attractions, or other information. Negatives - parking stalls are ridiculously small, especially because everyone drives large vehicles; pool is laughable (but who goes to this hotel for the pool?); and surrounding areas are not attractive. This is not "The Del," but by comparison, the money you spend there versus here makes this particular Holiday Inn Express a true find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andersons623
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1AM in the morning and thought wow what did we get ourselfs into.. The neighborhood looked bad.. Drove around in this little tiny parking garage there were 2 parking spots open but they are such small parking spots we couldnt fit our Yukon in it.. So i went in to check in and asked where we could park and they said on the street there wasnt even parking in the street.. They were nice enough to have security find us a place to park they let us block the dumpster so we were on hotel property that was nice. Then was told the elavator was broken.. So off me and my husband and our 4 yr old and 13yr old dragging our bags up concrete stairs at 1AM! Got to the room very nice room. Everything was new.. The beds were awesome it was clean had a microwave and a fridge carpets were new and clean.. Everything seemed great until we tried turning the AC on and it wouldnt work called the front desk the same security/handy man came up couldnt get it to work asked to be moved to a new room but was told they were sold out... He brought us up a fan and we slept with the window open which wouldnt have been bad if it wasnt facing a busy road... Spoke with the manager that morning she offered me 30% off our stay i said no that wasnt right then asked if she would give me a deal for that night in a room with AC said they were sold out.. She then offered me 60% off i told her no we had to listen to the traffic all night.. Ended up getting our night free that we stayed.. So that was nice.. The breakfest is pretty good they have alot of choices for free.. Good coffee... Overall we would stay again maybe once they fix there parking to offer more spots.. I would recommend this hotel the rooms are clean and new..

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: mschnickmann
Reviews.Content: a nice lil hotel close to seaworld. new renovations and a new management since 2010. great breakfast and very helpful employees. a nice lil pool and free parking. the streets around the hotel are save. when renovations are completed it will be one of the best hotels in the area i think. if youÂ´re looking for a simple hotel with a good housekeeping this is the right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Mom2OandE
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at the HI Express. The rooms were extremely clean and tidy. They were also spacious and had two queen size beds adn a pull out sofa along with a fridge and microwave. The halls were clean as well and you felt very safe. The breakfast was very good and a is a good money saver for families. Access to Sea World is a short drive from the hotel. The only down side I saw was the tight parking spaces.

Reviews.Title: “The negative experience at this hotel impacted the entire vacation.”
Reviews.Author: LAwmt
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a sick, dying rat next to the jacuzzi, loud freeway noise at 5am, and a horrible smell on the 3rd floor that could not be explained and didn't come from my boys. I brought the rat to the front desk before it could fall into the jacuzzi with my kids. They comped me one night for our disgust, but I asked for 2 nights and was flatly denied. The hotel is overpriced for the amenities provided. The pool is the size of a large jacuzzi. I am never staying there or at ANY Holiday Express again and made a complaint to the regional manager. I only receive a couple of weeks a year to spend with my kids on vacation and I am disapointed that our stay was so marred by my decision to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some people are too picky”
Reviews.Author: mainsail4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what one should expect when staying at a Holiday Inn Express. If you want to stay at a Four Seasons, that is where you should stay. You shouldn't stay here expecting a Four Seasons experience. Apparently that is what some people expect. Is the parking a little tight? Yes. If you aren't used to parking your car in a mall parking lot, than you will not be comfortable doing it here. I had rented an SUV and had NO TROUBLE parking it. I can't comment on the pool since I didn't see or use it. The breakfast was better than what I expected to see.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: moderngal42
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant, the location is great for Sea World, the rooms were average and is what should be expected of a Holiday Inn but the complementary breakfast was unexpectedly amazing. They had great options from cereal to cinnamon buns, eggs to yogurt, etc. The downside is there's no room to enjoy the breakfast. We had to take ours to go and eat it in our rooms, which was fine with us. There's no line system and the people staying there are rude and have no courtesy for others. The bed was a lil' hard and uncomfortable. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: SNAFU23
Reviews.Content: My family (kids 2 & 4) stayed at this hotel during our recent trip to Sea World. We found the hotel to be nice for the price paid. The hotel is close to Sea World, but not walking distance, especially if you have small kids in tow. The hotel is only about 1/2 mile from the park, but the park is located along a major highway with numerous freeway entrances you have to cross, so it's not really suitable for walking to the park. The hotel and room were very clean. The room came with a frig and microwave and HBO. There is no pay-per-view channels, or room safe. There is a breakfast provided each morning; fruit, breads, juices, eggs, biscuit and gravy, and bacon. Not special, but because it was free it will save you from having to go out and buy breakfast. The eating area is a little small, but you can always take the meal to your room. The pool and outdoor jacuzzi were a little small. Nothing special. I think they close at 10:00PM. I can see why other people said the parking was tight, it is limited, but while we were there we had no problems finding a spot. Across the street from the hotel are a lot of restaurants; Denny's, Soup Plantation, a Bar & Grill, CVA, Baskin Robbins. a short drive up the road are a lot of fast food restaurants. Overall you'll find this location to be a nice inexpensive hotel. I would stay again if going back to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: bigblue43
Reviews.Content: Well after reading some reviews we were apprehensive at first,but after arriving we found this hotel to be very well maintained and the staff very accomodating. We were in town for a wedding ,travelling with family and had reserved 4 rooms. Upon check in Angela made sure that all our rooms were ready. We had planned a large (around 25-30 people) family reunion w/ my niece. Her hotel however wanted to charge an additional $200.00 for use of a small meeting room, we spoke to Angela and she graciously accomodated us that evening in the hotels breakfast area free of charge. Simply outstanding!! Our rooms had king size beds & pull out sofa beds, the bathrooms were very nice w/ marble sinks, floor to ceiling marble shower enclosures,large mirrors and hair(blow) dryers. There were full length mirrored folding doors on the closets,ironing boards & irons inside. The rooms each had a refrigerator and microwave. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job each day of our stay. The morning breakfast,was good w/ a selection of cerels,fruits,eggs,bacon, juice, coffee ,etc. making for a good way to start the day. Although the hotel sits back from the main road, it is centrally located to all of the areas attractions. They do have a pool / jacuzzi, which although small is perfect for familys with children as it was not too deep (3.5-4.5ft). The only things that were a problem were the parking (which if you have a larger car can be tight) , the breakfast area which can be very crowded at peak times and there are some dead spots in the hotels wi-fi system. But that being said, it was not so much of a problem that it would have affected our stay. All in all we had a great stay and I would recommend this hotel to others, especially those travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Alan39
Reviews.Content: An older hotel but a nice one. Our room was quite large with two queen beds and a couch (could easily handled 6 people). Location was very convienet to sea world, zoo, old town and down town SD (by car ofcourse). Breakfast was the typical holiday inn express style which is pretty good. Eatring area however was quite small and if you get there during peak time you eaither stand and eat or take it up to your room. The area does seem maybe a bit shady but driving in and out that did not affect us any.

Reviews.Title: “Good location when visiting Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Aninkas
Reviews.Content: Dark room with small windows facing the corridor. But we had a nice stay. Everything is clean and if you are a pirvelage club member the staff is more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: awesthoff
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and had no problems. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was good and saved us a bundle. Our room was a little noisy because it was on the freeway side and the parking was a tight fit but that was our only complaint. Would stay again and recomend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice out of the way hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: macysue
Reviews.Content: We had two room for five days. The rooms were very nice with easy accessability for me with a handicap. The biggest problem was people without handicaps parking in handicap parking leaving me having to find some other place farther away to park. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The rooms we had would have easily slept 5. We had rooms 116, and 117. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to be near Sea World, the beaches or even the airport to use this hotel. There was no inside pool which would have been great for my 5 year old nephew because it was too cold to swim outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChamboYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Firstly this review is for the Holiday Inn Express at 3950 Juniper. After having read previous reviews and expecting the worst I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel is NOT the Holiday Inn next to Bakers Restaurant which a lot of the reviews written here are about. We stayed for 10 nights and had a trouble free stay. The rooms were spotlessy clean and the housekeeping was fantastic. Clean towels every day and toiletries replaced daily as well. There is undercover parking which was a bit tight but we had no trouble getting a parking spot everyday. Well situated for getting about, a taxi Downtown or to Mission Beach was about $16 (approx Â£9) where there are loads of places for eating and drinking. In walking distance of the hotel is a Soup Plantation which is just across the road - they have a buffett style salad & soup bar which is great when you have had enough of eating enormous portions and just want something reasonably light. Denny's (also across the road) is good for breakfast. We also walked down to Red Lobster and Phils BBQ and had great food at both. We had no problems walking about at night, you don't see many other people but we never felt unsafe. We mainly had breakfast at Bakers Restuarant ( next to the other Holiday Inn ) and Bakers is also excellent for afternoon cake & coffee. Bakers also has a bar attached to it - unfortunately it calls last orders at 10.15pm but you can get a couple of drinks in after your evening meal. For great shopping head to the border to the Las Americas Outlets, we spent the day there and bagged some real bargins. I can also recommend Old Town and the Navy Carrier HMS Midway is well worth a visit. All in all a great place to visit with plenty to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “need better housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: proudftd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here. We found the location convenient to both Sea World and the Zoo (our destinations in San Diego). We liked that they had pillow options on each bed - the pillowcases indicate if the pillow is soft or firm. We also liked the warm breakfast, but the food area was small and cramped. The parking garage was small with tight spaces. They did have some security in the garage which was comforting. Housekeeping wasn't good. They couldn't seem to supply us with 4 washclothes, even with two notes (two different days) and tips. Also, the floors were dirty and never cleaned properly.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn is OUT”
Reviews.Author: Brit-abroardly
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at end of California holiday. Checked out day early but would have liked to have left after first night. Travelling with 4 children. Allocated 1 room on 2nd floor , other along outdoor corridor up and down separate staircase in dark corner. Felt unsafe-evidence of break-ins on room door, saw male enter car park area and urinate by our car - adult shop on one side, tire depot on other. Busy road all around. Very noisy from 5 am. Beds very uncomfortable. Staff pleasant but did not act on any complaints. Room 501 appears to be worst in motel. My advise...STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed once that was enough”
Reviews.Author: bethlink
Reviews.Content: we booked a 5 day 4 night stay here I was ready to leave by the 2nd day there king suite is not all its cracked up to be theres no cooling in the back room and fridge wouldnt cool and they refuse to give money back on faulty washing machines and they clearly have a sign in your room stating if houskeeping has not cleaned your room in 24 hours managment will be calling your room well they never called we didnt get fresh towels till day 4 and my friend booked at the same time they gave her the same room we had but she booked the cheaper room so they got us by a couple hundred bucks there resturant is way way costly and my kids went down to get food they forced them to order off the adult menu not the kids menu so for 2 bigger kids and a 2 year old they paid almost 40.00 that is no joke I would not even recommend this hotel to my enemy good luck with your stay

Reviews.Title: “Worked Out Well”
Reviews.Author: thehouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked very well for us. The drive to Seaworld is about 5 minutes and it only took us about 20 minutes to reach downtown. The hotel is very nice and the staff was very god to us. The rooms were nice and clean. It was very busy so breakfast was tough and couldn't find a seat. The pool was the only thing I wouldlike to see inmproved it was very small and cramped, when thereare lots of kids it isn't a fun palce to hang out. The neighbor looks a little dirty but across the street is a nice shopping plaza with a drug store and a great cheesesteak place. I would stay here again if I returned to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: mommyof2greatkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with our 2 little children so we could go to Sea World. I loved it. Lived up to and surpassed every expectation. It was extremely clean, friendly staff, nice linens on comfortable beds, a fridge and microwave in the room and even a hairdryer and tub in the bathroom. Just minutes from Sea World. Oh and the free breakfast was AWESOME. All we could eat and good variety. Basic stuff but very good and filled our tummies in the mornings! Very happy and would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “close to sea world”
Reviews.Author: ElaineT1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just off the freeway, not a great area for walking around, but good enough for an overnight stay to access the park - only 10 mins away at most. No freeway noise. Clean. Nice staff. Didn't use the pool. Breakfast quite good, a lot of choices. Garage parking. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “OK - but area is a little seedy...”
Reviews.Author: Anita40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my son on a visit to Sea World at the end of March 2008. I booked through the Sea World web site. At the end of the day at Sea World I called for directions to the hotel and the person who answered the phone could not tell me how to get there from Sea World! He also said that no one else was there who could help me! He was able to tell me how to get there from the freeway but didn't know if I should go north or south from Sea World - after driving north on the 5 for 10 miles I turned around and found that it was the next exit just south of Sea World. By the time got there I was not a happy camper but tried to give him the benefit of the doubt as he was new. Driving in from the freeway I almost headed to another hotel that I was familiar with in downtown San Diego becuase of the fact that there were strip clubs and adult book stores on every corner for several blocks coming off of the freeway. After I turned toward the hotel it got a little better but, being there by myself with just my son, it was a litte unnerving (sp?)! Check in went fine but there wasn't enough parking in the lot closest to our room so we had to walk across several dark parking lots to get to the building. The room was very clean and nice for a hotel like this. Although we had no problems I was a bit nervous that the rooms open out onto a balcony that can be accessed by anyone. We had planned on spending the morning in the hotel pool until check out but it wasn't a very good one - surrounded by cinder block walls at the back of the Bakers Square restaurant right on the parking lot. Not a place I really wanted to hang out for the morning! We did get a free voucher for a free children's breakfast at Bakers Square so that was a plus. I would look around a little more for another hotel if you are travelling with children. The area is a little seedy and it really isn't that close to Sea World. You can do better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for families”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with two young children. While it is close to Sea World, what we did not realize when booking the reservation was that there are adult establishments on almost every corner in the surrounding neighborhood. It is definitely not a neighborhood to walk around in. When we arrived a huge convention was going on at the Sports Arena. It was extremely busy and the crowd was rowdy. Directly across from our room was the fire department so we heard sirens off and on all day. There are a lot of homeless in the area also. As for the room, it was very clean and the bunk beds for the kids were nice. However, the room was cramped, the air was horrible and the voucher for "kids eat free" at the Baker's Square on site was only good if the kids ate off the kids' menu. They still charged them for drinks too. We ended up cutting our stay short of the 5 nights we had planned to stay. We would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel / not-so-nice area”
Reviews.Author: kgreenaz
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit scared when we drove to the hotel because we drove through a bad area with adult clubs and a somewhat industrial area. The hotel itself is nice and the staff is extremely nice and friendly. Everyone we met that works there was friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi in the rooms is really nice. The beds were comfortable for us and they had hard and soft pillows to choose from. The amenities are nice for hotel amenities. I prefer to bring my own. The heater was extremely noisy and, although we had a "quiet" room, the freeway noise was obvious. I did two loads of laundry with no issues. Breakfast service is nice with coffee, tea, cinnamon rolls, cereal, yogurt and fruit. Lots of juices to choose from. It was nice to go down at night to get some tea for my husband and they had the beverages available. Really nice feature. We didn't visit the pool but we wouldn't have wanted to. It was tiny and looked squeezed into a very small area. The hotel is great but I wish it were in a different location. We had breakfast at a nearby IHOP and it was across the street from a Hustler adult club. Freeway access was easy and it is really close to SeaWorld!! Parking was not an issue for us because it was winter but only has a small lot that is covered and under the hotel. Not sure how it would be in the peak season. We liked the hotel but would not stay there again. We'll try Hotel Circle again and keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Our third time here.”
Reviews.Author: James340
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a little weekend getaway involving a stop in Encinitas on Friday and a day long visit to Sea World on Saturday. We chose this hotel because of the wonderful experiences we previously had. This is our third time at this hotel and it continues to be perfect for us in every way. As others have said, the staff is great. The breakfast in the morning is filling. (Try those cinnamon rolls.) And of course that five minute drive to Sea World is the best. There is plenty to do around the hotel as well. There is a Chuck E Cheese down the street to let the kids blow off some steam. Red Lobster, Target, and many other places to eat and shop. As for the hotel, we have no complaints. Very quiet, well kept, and the room accomodated our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jhptloma
Reviews.Content: I was lloking for a hotel near seaworld. I found this gem tucked away just off the I8. We were welcomed by the front desk as if we were familly coming in from a vacation. Instantly we felt at home. As it turns out not only were the front desk agents extemely helpfull, they had greaqt knowledge of the local area and were able to suggest many things to do besides seaworld. The breakfast was excelent and you can't beat the price as it was complimentary, and the rooms were surprisingly specious and came with a microwave and refridgerator, the complementery bottles of water were a nice touch and all in all I don't think that for the price I could have found a better hotel to stay in. I would recomend staying there anytime, and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: HendryBC
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on Trip Advisor so did not have high expectations. Beds were uncomfortable and it was definitely a step down from the Homewood Suites in Anaheim. Just OK but nothing wrong - rooms are small for 4. Would not recommend a long stay but OK for 1-2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Generae01
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego for a 5 day vacation early in the morning and wanted to check into our room to drop our bags off. When I called, the gentleman at the desk said he could probably have a room ready for us around 11 AM and asked that I call back. Sure enough when I called back our room was ready and we checked in several hours early. The room and bathroom were both very clean and the bathroom was fairly good size. We had one king size bed and the couch pulled out to make another bed. Also had a fridge and microwave which came in very handy. If you're expecting bacon and eggs in the morning you won't get it here but they did have a good selection of cereal, oatmeal, muffins, toast, etc..... Like other reviews the location can be a bit hard to find and if you're not careful you'll drive right by the hotel. The sign for the hotel is very small. Once you figure the roads out it's easy to get anywhere you need to go. It's 5 minutes or so to Sea World and Mission Beach and doesn't take to much longer to get to Hwy 5. We didn't use the pool but it was fairly small. Parking is underneath the hotel so a majority of it is obviously covered. Overall this is a clean hotel with a friendly staff and if you're looking to save money on a place to sleep this is the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for $”
Reviews.Author: cpertuti
Reviews.Content: We had large spacious rooms with microwave and refrigerator, bed and linens were extremely comfortable, fancy toiletries provided in large bathroom. Wonderful breakfast buffet - just wished they had a larger area to eat in. Location is a tad difficult to find. If you pass the Home Depot, you're on the right track. Keep going - the hotel is at a cul de sac. Parking is limited and for compact cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mindyto
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff was always nice and helpful. We arrived at the hotel a couple of hours before check in and they let us check in anyway. The front desk people were always willing to help with directions or suggestions of places to eat or see. The pool is small and not very warm, but the kids loved it. The hot tub was nice. The pool area is nicely landscaped. The parking spaces are really small, but I like that it was covered. The breakfast was great and had a lot of options. The rooms were big - including 2 queen beds and a sofabed. The linens and furnishings were nice. Everything was extremely clean and taken care of. The bathroom was also very big. Our last night we upgraded to the 2 queen suite. That included a kitchenette, small dining area, and a small living room area. It was really nice - we wish we could have got this room the whole time. The extra space was wonderful! The hotels location is wonderful. It is close to everything - including Seaworld, Old Town, Beaches, and the freeway. Overall we loved this hotel!! I will stay here again when we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: chubbles777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice decent place to stay in, but it was a bit smaller than I imagined from reading the other reviews. Most of the cabbies didn't know where this hotel was. It is in the middle of nowhere, on a tiny side street. The rooms were nice and clean, the staff was friendly. Breakfast was available every morning. Clean fast food, pharmacies and public transportation was available across the street. Pool is extremely small and not safe after early evening. We had an incident there with a homeless person waiting for us to get out so they could use it. Overall, it was a decent place to stay in, however, it is nicer to rent a car and transport, since it's quiet and deserted at night.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: kevsand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in October 2006. We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Seaworld. It is perfect as it is only a five minute drive from Seaworld, however the roads are a bit confusing getting there. The Holiday Inn was perfect, neat, clean and all the facilities that you would expect from the Holiday Inn. Our room included a very nice breakfast. Overall, you can't go wrong with a Holiday Inn Express!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: xshadowkattx
Reviews.Content: I loved this Inn! It was very beautiful. The room was very well kept and everything was nice. My fiance and I stayed for two nights. The staff was very friendly and heloful. I loved the parking. You can use the guest entrance and don't have to walk through the lobby. I will stay here again when I go back to Seaworld. It's not not far from Seaworld, about a 5 to 10 min drive. The only thing I didn't like was it was on a street that was confusing to get to. My fiance and I almost passed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Applejacker
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were quite nice and very clean. Staff was very helpful and courteous. The beds were very comfortable. The free wireless Internet ran well and was quite helpful researching things to do as well as mapping our excursions. The free HI Express breakfast bar was terrific, covering a whole gamut of choices, though seating was limited during the peak times of the morning. Location was great as Sea World is only a mile or two away and the SD Zoo only a few more in the other direction. Several decent restaurants were within walking distance, including the Embers right across the street. The price was quite reasonable at about $100 per day (internet prepayed) for all we received. Parking, though, was an annoyance as the stalls were much too narrow and cramped. All in all, we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and great value”
Reviews.Author: MrsKCork
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this HI Express! The staff was extremely courteous, the proximity to Sea World fantastic, and the rooms really spacious, clean, and modern. The two-day-for-the-price-of-one Sea World tickets were a big plus. There is a supermarket across the road and bus stops very close to the hotel which is handy to go into & out of town and to Sea World. The "high speed" internet connection in the rooms was very slow and hard to get on but they do have a computer with high speed for public use in the lobby, which served us well for getting directions places or finding restauants. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: colntam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the HI Express (Sea World) for two night before flying home and were not impressed. The street that the hotel was on had a great deal of old broken down motorhomes on it so the first impression was not so good. The front dest staff was not very helpful for us. They must have left two trainees at the desk because when we asked for some advise to get to a resturant the woman simply said in her best english "sorry I don't know", and handed us a tour book that was from1990. The first morning that we stayed there my wife complained about some bumps on her ankles which multiplied the second morning and upon return to Toronto our doctor diagnosed flea bites. Maybe not from that room but we were bite free for nearly 2 weeks before. I would not go back to this particular HI Express. We stayed a quite a few on our trip and this was the worst. Lot's of loud running in the halls all night too and a bit of a smokey smell in the halls. On the bright side the bathroom was really big and lots of water pressure and it was close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: justmewonderinginyuma
Reviews.Content: I won't spend my money here again. Small parking spaces. The front desk messed up and charged my credit card again for a room that was already "advanced purchased". They blamed my credit card company for their mistake! The rooms were basic and the food choices were small. I have stayed at many Holiday Inn Express's and this one wasn't good.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: rierie78
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this HI Express! The staff was extremely courteous, the proximity to Sea World fantastic, and the rooms incredibly spacious, clean, and modern. I was a little dissapointed tto find that there was no Sea World shuttle service (like I had read somewhere online), but the two-day-for-the-price-of-one Sea World tickets were a big plus. The only negative thing about this hotel was very small parking spaes in the tiny underground lot. Don't bring your SUV or van and expect to park here without some talented manuvering! Also, it was difficult getting in and out of the hotel from Sports Arena Blvd. (a divided main street.) It requires flipping many a u-turn. The "high speed" internet connection in the rooms was very slow and hard to get on. They do have a computer with high speed for public use in the lobby, which served us well for getting directions places or finding restauants. The positives far outweighed the negatives at this hotel, and we would most certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but nice”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 20 - 23 June 2006. Requested room wasn't available on our first night but the staff compensated with adjoining rooms. We were moved into a very nice and large one bedroom suite on our second night. This isn't a fancy place but it's clean, centrally located, and has a decent breakfast and warm pool. Great for families or travellers on a budget wanting a quality place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good”
Reviews.Author: ecossealba
Reviews.Content: An excellent clean hotel ideally located for sea world. I stayed in a suite with my wife, neice and son. The room was very spacious.............why can't all budget hotels be like this one...........oh and by the way despite what others say the buffet breakfast was fine and included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTWGETTY
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel not fancy. The room was clean and the staff was very nice. In fact one morining we missed brunch yet the woman serving brunch got us cereal and milk even though she was cleaning up. If all you need is a clean comfortable place to sleep that won't cost an arm and a leg. This works. The neighborhood is not great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: fireman-175
Reviews.Content: This place almost deserves an excellent, if not for the awefully small parking spaces and busy elevator. My family with a 4 and 6 year old stayed here around April 11th for 3 nights. Kind of tricky finding, but once you know where it is, it is okay. We found the beds to be excellent, they were firm and not that aweful soft pillowtop junk other hotels are cramming down our throats. (We yanked the top off the beds at our last place in LA) The rooms were clean and well stocked with nice absorbant towels and a nice bathroom. There is a coffee maker, refridgerator, microwave, good ac/heater. Even though this is by a highway, we didn't here any traffic. I am a light sleeper, so believe me. There was a free breakfast included. Parking is underground, but small spaces. I didn't get to try the pool, but the other kids seemed to have a ball. Staff is very friendly, but doesn't know any good spots for recommendations. They read off a sheet provided to them. One small issue was the bathtub was not cleaned. We notified the manager on duty whom sent us up some requested cleaning supplies so we could clean it ourselves at our request. This was very prompt and acceptable to us. For a one star hotel, this is tops!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at the Holiday Inn while visiting the zoo and sea world, but it turned out to be very pleasant. It was kind of scary when I pulled up but everything changed once inside. The hotel looks new & the staff was very friendly. The lady at the desk always had a smile when I asked for directions and I'm sure she's given those directions a thousand times. The breakfast was great for being free. They have trays so you can take the food to your room. They also have a computer in the lobby for you to use for free. Parking is tight but free. I could hear the outside noise pretty good and that was a little annoying but got used to it. Overall I say great value and great spot to visit the attractions. 5-10 minutes to Seaworld and 10-15 minutes to the zoo. Don't pass up Mission beach if you have small children. Great park there. Wahoos is great Mexican food (and cheap).

Reviews.Title: “Very plesant experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this hotel was such a pleasant experience; I can't say enough positive things about it and felt compelled to pass them along. I would "echo" all positive comments I read above regarding spacious rooms and clean bedding which almost appeared to be new. All the public areas we were in, i.e. hallway, lobby, etc. appeared to have been remodeled recently. The hallway was wide, well lighted, attractive and very safe feeling. The staff were helpful and represented their jobs very well. Parking is "tight" but safe, no charge, and available. It is true the pool is on the small side and view not the best, but above things far out weighed these. Breakfast bar was very adequate and the lady who attended to it was so nice. I too cannot imagine the previous negative comments stayed at this particular Holiday Inn Express??? All in all this stay made my first trip to San Diego a very pleasant one. I would highly recommend to any family visiting the Sea World area or any part of SanDiego for that matter. Thanks to Holday Inn Express for providing a quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “3 grad students: No complaints, definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a single night in February 2006 en route to a conference/exhibition. Very pleased with the size and cleanliness of rooms. 2 queen beds plus a fold-out from the couch was at a great rate for us "budget" travelers. Lobby was welcoming and clean, and desk personnel were very helpful with recommendations and directions for local dining and attractions. Continental breakfast was generously diverse and well-stocked. Covered parking was attractive & comfortably safe. As grad students, we probably have lower standards than business or family travelers, but we were definately impressed and would visit again (even on business or with a family)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location - near Sea World”
Reviews.Author: jhansenTucson
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this establishment(Mar 24th-25th)and enjoyed the visit. There were 5 people in our group, 4 adults and one small child, and the deluxe room with 2 queen beds definately met our needs. Our deluxe room was very spacious, two queen beds, a small sofa w/ small coffee table, mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, desk w/ chair, dresser, and nightstand. The bathroom had a very large vanity area, a wonderful bathtub/shower that was equipped with the infamous curved shower rod so that the curtain never touches you.(Kudos to the inventor!) The continential breakfast exceeded our expectations- It included items such as: Coffee, Juice, Milk, Hot Chocolate, Bagels w/ Cream Cheese, Pastries, Toast, Fresh Fruit, Yogurt, Hard Boiled Eggs, selection of 3-4 cold cereals and instant oatmeal... and let us not forget the infamous cinnamon rolls! The were great!!! The breakfast area was very clean, and continuously monitored/stocked by the very friendly & efficient staff. The staff was very helpful & courteous in directions to local attractions, restaurants, etc. As I had read in reviews prior to making our reservation, the parking garage has the potential to be a little tight, however my husband had no problem in manuvering our full size Ford pickup in and out of spaces. Overall, this hotel was a great value for our the money, very close to Sea World. We would recommend this establishment to our family & friends, and choose to stay here again on our future San Diego adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure that the previous reviewer stayed at the same hotel. The Holiday Inn Express SeaWorld San Diego is in a great location, and for the money I don't know where else you'd find this quality of accomodation right in the city. Breakfast was certainly included - and the woman who looked after the breakfast area was friendly and worked non-stop to make sure that everything was replentished. The staff were also very friendly and able to provide directions to all of our destinations. The rooms are large and clean, with the only downside being that the view from the room was of some run down housing. We kept one set of the drapes closed. Parking was never a problem for us - for the 3 nights we stayed, we actually parked on the street right in front of the hotel and never had to use the garage. There were several casual restaurants in the area which we were able to walk to at night. If I am ever fortunate enough to visit San Diego again, I would not hestitate staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hikinggal
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews posted on this site of several hotels prior to making my reservations in San Diego. I am very happy to say that all the prior reviews were absolutely correct regarding the Holiday Inn Express. The staff at this hotel are awesome and were able to answer all my questions, give accurate directions etc. making my first trip to this area most comfortable. The parking garage is tight and my mid-size rental ended up being a mini van but I had no trouble working my way in and out of parking spots. My room had a small kitchenette which was most helpful. I bought a few groceries and was able to eat supper in my room. The hotel is close to highways and it never took me more than 15-20 min to reach my destination. I would definately recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, not a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on trip advisor, which led us to stay at the Holiday Inn Sea World. Granted the price was much less than nicer places in San Diego -- and now we know why. Our hotel room view was of the freeway and a dry dock junk boat yard. Rooms were okay. Mold on the bathroom ceiling. Kithenette meant small fridge and mini microwave in the room. Okay if you're on a tight budget, and very close to sea world but not a nice neighborhood. The pool was tiny and crammed in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: The good The room was quite spacious and very clean, and recently updated. Wide bathtub, with a curved shower curtain rod which keeps the shower curtain away from you (a nice touch). Clean carpets. Small sitting area with a couch. Two telephones. Location close to Rte. 8. Helpful staff. Good selection of foods in the complementary breakfast. The not so good The bed is rather hard, not so comfortable, with rather threadbare sheets and thin blankets. Out-of-the-way location. Elevator and hallways a bit dingy. Some airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tara1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Holiday Inn Express hotel (Sea World) for 3 days and loved it. Here are some great things abt the hotel 1)Breakfast was excellent and starts promptly at 6:30 am. The staff is extremely courteous and keep a watchful eye on food / coffee that need refills. 2)The rooms and corridors and even the lifts were spic n span. 3)The room had a microwave and a fridge and we could get food from outside and reheat at our convenience. 4)There is a vending machine for midnight snacks. 5)Very close to most of the tourist attractions like Zoo, Se World, La Jolla, Gas Lamp etc. 6)Free Internet access. 7) Lots of restaurants close by like Olive Garden, Red Robin, Chipotle etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: samanthasopoe
Reviews.Content: Great value in San Diego. You need a car at this location, though. It's not conveniently close to a trolley stop. Parking is tight in the garage, but doable. The pool area is uninviting -- clean, but small and reachable only through the garage. However, if you have a car and don't care about a pool, this is an expertly run hotel, dedicated to caring for the guests. There's a free computer and printer in the lobby for guest use. We had a sofa in the room, as well as a refrigerator and microwave. It's also on a quiet side street. The staff was courteous and responsive to our needs. The location is convenient to the Mission Bay area and points north, just blocks away from the Sports Arena, and no more than ten minutes from Old Town, downtown, and Balboa Park by car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff - centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Billpa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at this hotel and enjoyed my stay completely. The rooms have plenty of space and are very clean. The bathroom is good sized and also kept very clean. The only thing missing there would be possibly a heat lamp in the ceiling since it does get cool, esp since the bathroom door automatically closes. The staff is extremely helpful with directions and assisting you with anything they can. If you are want to go out on one of the harbor excursions make sure you ask them about it since they have discounts to things such as the whale watching. It can save you a few bucks depending on how may are going. I agree with everyone else that the cinnamon rolls are delicious. They also have rolls and muffins, cereal, fruit and a variety of standard continental breakfast items. It's plenty to fill you in the morning and it's free. The parking in the garage is quite tight as others have mentioned. It's worse when some people don't bother to stay in the lines. I had no real issues though during my stay. The free wireless in the rooms is a great feature. If you have a laptop make sure you bring it with you. The pc/printer in the lobby is also a great feature. The hotel can be a little difficult to get to once you get off the freeway. If you fly in and follow the directions that came on the confirmation you'll end up going the wrong direction on I-5 (shows I-5 South). You will need to go North on I-5 up to I-8 West. Once you exit I-8 make the left at the light and then go to the next light and make a left again (before the light you'll see the hotel on your left but you can't turn left or make a u-turn). You can then make a u-turn down the road further or at the next light. There were a lot of families staying here, I'm sure due to how close it is to SeaWorld. They all seemed to enjoy their stay. The rates were extremely reasonable for the San Diego area. My AAA rate was great.

Reviews.Title: “I loved their breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying at this hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bathroom was also a pleasant surprise. It was roomy and the custom shower head added a nice touch. We stayed in a room with a double queen and a sofa bed. I personally slept on the sofabed and I had a good night's rest. We had 3 adults and 3 kids but didn't feel cramped in this room. The free breakfast was the best part of our stay. The reviews were absolutely correct about the cinnamon rolls. They were the best! The location of this hotel was also very close to Sea World, which was the reason why we were there in the first place. Many things like restaurants, grocery stores, and the beach were close by. The negative things about this hotel was the cramped and few parking spaces in the garage. It was free though. They had a small pool but we didn't use it so I can't tell you if it was good or not. But we didn't go there for the pool. It was actually a very nice stay for us. I was very pleased.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Sea World
HotelInfo.Address: 3950 Jupiter St., San Diego, CA 92110
